com.heaton.bot
Interface IWorkloadStorable

All Known Implementing Classes:
SpiderSQLWorkload, SpiderInternalWorkload
public interface IWorkloadStorable

This interface defines a class that can be used to store a spider's workload. The Bot package currently supports two different workload stores: SpiderInternalWorkload - Stores the contents of the workload in memory. SpiderSQLWorkload - Stores the contents of the workload in an SQL database. Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

          Processing of this URL resulted in an error.

static char UNKNOWN

static char WAITING
          This URL is waiting for a spider worker to take it on.

Field Detail

RUNNING

public static final char RUNNING
A workload entry has a status of running if the spider worker is opening or downloading that page. This state usually goes to COMPLETE or ERROR.

ERROR

public static final char ERROR
Processing of this URL resulted in an error.

WAITING

public static final char WAITING
This URL is waiting for a spider worker to take it on.

COMPLETE

public static final char COMPLETE
This page is complete and should not be redownloaded.

UNKNOWN

public static final char UNKNOWN
The status is unknown.
Method Detail

assignWorkload

public java.lang.String assignWorkload()
Call this method to request a URL to process. This method will return a WAITING URL and mark it as RUNNING.
Returns:
The URL that was assigned.

addWorkload

public void addWorkload(java.lang.String url)
Add a new URL to the workload, and assign it a status of WAITING.
Parameters:
url - The URL to be added.

completeWorkload

public void completeWorkload(java.lang.String url,
                             boolean error)
Called to mark this URL as either COMPLETE or ERROR.
Parameters:
url - The URL to complete.
error - true - assign this workload a status of ERROR. false - assign this workload a status of COMPLETE.

getURLStatus

public char getURLStatus(java.lang.String url)
Get the status of a URL.
Parameters:
url - Returns either RUNNING, ERROR WAITING, or COMPLETE. If the URL does not exist in the database, the value of UNKNOWN is returned.
Returns:
Returns either RUNNING,ERROR, WAITING,COMPLETE or UNKNOWN.

clear

public void clear()
Clear the contents of the workload store.
